PlaceDescription: A National Historic Landmark founded in 1732 as one of America's earliest religious communal societies, featuring unique 18th-century architecture, music, and printing press history
Massive Friday-only market (60 acres) with 400+ vendors: fresh produce, Amish goods, flea market items, food stands, and auctions—a Lancaster County staple.

PlaceName: Winters Leadership Memorial at Veterans' Plaza
PlaceDescription: Bronze statue honoring WWII hero Major Dick Winters (Band of Brothers) from Ephrata, with engraved pavers and educational plaques in a peaceful park setting

PlaceName: Seiverling Museum LLC Car and Pedal Car Museum
PlaceDescription: Unique private collection of over 140 vintage pedal cars and antique toys, housed in a historic building with guided tours available
Intimate community theater in the historic Sharadin Bigler Theatre offering Broadway-quality musicals, plays, and performances year-round
Scenic 8-mile paved trail connecting Ephrata to Lititz, perfect for walking or biking past Amish farms, woodlands, and historic sites

PlaceName: Historical Society of the Cocalico Valley
PlaceDescription: Museum and research library showcasing Ephrata-area artifacts, genealogy records, and exhibits on local Pennsylvania Dutch history
Eclectic creative reuse center and shop filled with donated art supplies, vintage items, and upcycled treasures— a paradise for crafters
Cozy downtown tasting room featuring local Pennsylvania wines in a relaxed setting with charcuterie and occasional live music
Popular craft brewery in a historic building offering house-made beers, pub fare, outdoor seating, and a welcoming community vibe
